Desc.entry: A working farm which breeds alpacas and is open to the public to visit. There is a trail marked with arrows that takes about half an hour to walk around to see the 70 alpacas resident on the farm. Also keeps other animal such as horses, pigs, ducks and geese. There are educational facilities for schools tracing the history of alpacas to the 15th century. Also includes a coffee shop and shop selling alpaca woollens and clothing. Dogs are welcome but should be kept on a non-extending lead.
